meaningMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word is made up of a single kanji, it probably uses the kun'yomi reading. You did not learn this reading, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

Snap all the <vocabulary>bowstring</vocabulary>s! Now none of the musicians can play their instruments. "You're <reading>too ru</reading>de (つる)!" they yell, as they cry over the snapped bowstrings. They aren't wrong, that was just too rude of you.
